verses.kjv: And it came to pass the same year, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fourth year, and in the fifth month, that Hananiah the son of Azur the prophet, which was of Gibeon, spake unto me in the house of the LORD, in the presence of the priests and of all the people, saying,
verses.web: That same year, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fourth year, in the fifth month, Hananiah the son of Azzur, the prophet, who was of Gibeon, spoke to me in LORD’s house, in the presence of the priests and of all the people, saying,
verses.ct: That same year — the 4th year of King Zedekiah of Judah's reign, in the 5th month — a prophet named Hananiah son of Azur, from Gibeon, spoke to me in the LORD's house. With all the priests and people watching, he said,

verses.kjv: Thus speaketh the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, saying, I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.
verses.web: “LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says, ‘I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.
verses.ct: "This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: 'I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.

verses.kjv: Within two full years will I bring again into this place all the vessels of the LORD’s house, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place, and carried them to Babylon:
verses.web: Within two full years I will bring again into this place all the vessels of LORD’s house, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place, and carried to Babylon.
verses.ct: Within 2 full years, I will bring back to this place every vessel from the LORD's house that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took from here and carried off to Babylon.

verses.kjv: And I will bring again to this place Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, with all the captives of Judah, that went into Babylon, saith the LORD: for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.
verses.web: I will bring again to this place Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, with all the captives of Judah, who went to Babylon,’ says LORD; ‘for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.’ ”
verses.ct: I will also bring back to this place Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, along with all the captives of Judah who were taken to Babylon,' declares the LORD. 'I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.'"

verses.kjv: Then the prophet Jeremiah said unto the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests, and in the presence of all the people that stood in the house of the LORD,
verses.web: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests, and in the presence of all the people who stood in LORD’s house,
verses.ct: Then the prophet Jeremiah responded to the prophet Hananiah right there in front of the priests and all the people standing in the LORD's house.

verses.kjv: Even the prophet Jeremiah said, Amen: the LORD do so: the LORD perform thy words which thou hast prophesied, to bring again the vessels of the LORD’s house, and all that is carried away captive, from Babylon into this place.
verses.web: even the prophet Jeremiah said, “Amen! May LORD do so. May LORD perform your words which you have prophesied, to bring again the vessels of LORD’s house, and all those who are captives, from Babylon to this place.
verses.ct: Jeremiah said, "Amen! May the LORD do exactly that! May the LORD make your prophecy come true and bring back the vessels of the LORD's house and all the captives from Babylon to this place.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless hear thou now this word that I speak in thine ears, and in the ears of all the people;
verses.web: Nevertheless listen now to this word that I speak in your ears, and in the ears of all the people:
verses.ct: But listen carefully to what I'm about to say — to you and to everyone here.

verses.kjv: The prophets that have been before me and before thee of old prophesied both against many countries, and against great kingdoms, of war, and of evil, and of pestilence.
verses.web: The prophets who have been before me and before you of old prophesied against many countries, and against great kingdoms, of war, of evil, and of pestilence.
verses.ct: The prophets who came before you and me, long ago, prophesied war, disaster, and plague against many countries and powerful kingdoms.

verses.kjv: The prophet which prophesieth of peace, when the word of the prophet shall come to pass, then shall the prophet be known, that the LORD hath truly sent him.
verses.web: The prophet who prophesies of peace, when the word of the prophet happens, then the prophet will be known, that LORD has truly sent him.”
verses.ct: But when a prophet prophesies peace, only when that prophecy actually comes true will people know that the LORD truly sent him."

verses.kjv: Then Hananiah the prophet took the yoke from off the prophet Jeremiah’s neck, and brake it.
verses.web: Then Hananiah the prophet took the bar from off the prophet Jeremiah’s neck, and broke it.
verses.ct: Then Hananiah grabbed the wooden yoke off Jeremiah's neck and snapped it in two.

verses.kjv: And Hananiah spake in the presence of all the people, saying, Thus saith the LORD; Even so will I break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from the neck of all nations within the space of two full years. And the prophet Jeremiah went his way.
verses.web: Hananiah spoke in the presence of all the people, saying, “LORD says: ‘Even so I will break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from off the neck of all the nations within two full years.’ ” Then the prophet Jeremiah went his way.
verses.ct: Hananiah announced to the whole crowd, "This is what the LORD says: 'Just like this, I will break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from the neck of every nation within 2 full years.'" After that, Jeremiah walked away.

verses.kjv: Then the word of the LORD came unto Jeremiah the prophet, after that Hananiah the prophet had broken the yoke from off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
verses.web: Then LORD’s word came to Jeremiah, after Hananiah the prophet had broken the bar from off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
verses.ct: Sometime after Hananiah had broken the yoke off Jeremiah's neck, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:

verses.kjv: Go and tell Hananiah, saying, Thus saith the LORD; Thou hast broken the yokes of wood; but thou shalt make for them yokes of iron.
verses.web: “Go, and tell Hananiah, saying, ‘LORD says, “You have broken the bars of wood, but you have made in their place bars of iron.”
verses.ct: "Go tell Hananiah that the LORD says this: 'You broke a yoke made of wood, but you've only caused me to replace it with a yoke made of iron.'

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; I have put a yoke of iron upon the neck of all these nations, that they may serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and they shall serve him: and I have given him the beasts of the field also.
verses.web: For LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says, “I have put a yoke of iron on the neck of all these nations, that they may serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and they will serve him. I have also given him the animals of the field.” ’ ”
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: 'I have placed an iron yoke on the neck of all these nations, forcing them to serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon — and serve him they will. I have even given him control over the wild animals.'"

verses.kjv: Then said the prophet Jeremiah unto Hananiah the prophet, Hear now, Hananiah; The LORD hath not sent thee; but thou makest this people to trust in a lie.
verses.web: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to Hananiah the prophet, “Listen, Hananiah! LORD has not sent you, but you make this people trust in a lie.
verses.ct: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to Hananiah, "Listen to me, Hananiah! The LORD did not send you. You are making these people trust in a lie.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD; Behold, I will cast thee from off the face of the earth: this year thou shalt die, because thou hast taught rebellion against the LORD.
verses.web: Therefore LORD says, ‘Behold, I will send you away from off the surface of the earth. This year you will die, because you have spoken rebellion against LORD.’ ”
verses.ct: So the LORD says this: 'I am going to remove you from the face of the earth. You will die this very year, because you have preached rebellion against the LORD.'"

verses.kjv: So Hananiah the prophet died the same year in the seventh month.
verses.web: So Hananiah the prophet died the same year in the seventh month.
verses.ct: Hananiah the prophet died that same year, in the 7th month.
